com.example.anna.colorgame

Class ChooseGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • com.example.anna.colorgame.SuperActivity
        • com.example.anna.colorgame.ChooseGame

  • public class ChooseGame
extends SuperActivity
    This class is ChooseGame activity window only available to User with ID 0. Every button on the screen represents a game user may choose. When a button is pressed, game is choosen and data is sent to server. ProgressDialog pops on the screen while waiting for opponent (User 1) to join the game.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChooseGame() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onBackPressed()
      This method is called when user pushes "Back" button on the screen.
      void onClick(View view)
      This method is called when one of the buttons is clicked in the GUI.
      boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
      This method is called when user push "UP" button on the screen.
      void startGame()
      This method is called when User 0 receive "start" message from server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChooseGame

        public ChooseGame()

    • Method Detail

      • onClick

        public void onClick(View view)
        This method is called when one of the buttons is clicked in the GUI. Each button represents a game. Which button is pushed is stored in data variable. Then the semicolon and userID is added to data string and sent to startAsyncTask method.
        Parameters:
        view - View

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method is called when User 0 receive "start" message from server. It closes active ProgressDialog and starts the Game activity.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        This method is called when user push "UP" button on the screen. onBackPressed() method is called to show AlertDialog.
        Parameters:
        item - MenuItem
        Returns:
        boolean

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        This method is called when user pushes "Back" button on the screen. startNextActivity() method is called to start MainMenu activity.
